attributes.action: Introduce consequences of prolonged pornography use into sex education
attributes.background: Symptoms of porn addiction include intense feelings of depression, shame and isolation, a disintegration of relationships with family and friends, loss of interest in non-porn activities such as school, socialising, exercise and trouble in school. Children must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Mary Anne Layden, called porn the ‘most concerning thing to psychological health that I know of existing today.’ “The internet is a perfect drug delivery system because you are anonymous, aroused and have role models for these behaviours,”. “To have drugs pumped into your house 24/7, free, and children know how to use it better than grown-ups — it’s a perfect delivery system if we want to have a whole generation of young addicts who will never have the drug out of their minds,” she added.

"If we, as a society, shy away from talking about this issue, we are failing the thousands of young people it is affecting" Peter Liver.

The younger the user, the greater the neural response to porn, potentially for the long-term (Cambridge University Study).

attributes.action: Brexit deal must contain a clause allowing us rejoin the EU on the same terms
attributes.background:
As a form of insurance against a potentially destructive Brexit we the undersigned petition the government to include a clause in any deal with the EU to allow us to rejoin on the exact same terms we are on now.

This will give us the ultimate get out clause if Brexit is as damaging as predicted.

attributes.action: Increase the age that a puppy can be imported into the UK to six months.
attributes.background:
By doing so the risk to the individuals dog's health and behaviour, the risk to healthy dogs within this country will reduced hugely.  
This will tackle the illegal puppy trade as dogs will be more mature when imported and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Importing a puppy can cause great harm to the dog through the impacts it will have on its behaviour and health. This also put other dogs at risk as the puppy can be carrying diseases such as rabies and lung worm which are not found natively in the UK. 
By raising the legal age of importing it reduces these risks along with tackling the illegal puppy trade. At six months old dogs are more mature and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.

attributes.action: Consider legislation that guarantees every community has access to at a free ATM
attributes.background: It is a myth that an advanced society must necessarily be cashless. In Germany, a country which knows the perils of authoritarianism, more than 80% of transactions are in cash, as citizens safeguard their privacy and freedom. Even in the US, 45% of transactions are in cash.
attributes.additional_details:
Cash machines ‘to disappear within a decade’, ATM boss warns

Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2017/12/03/cash-machines-to-disappear-within-a-decade-atm-boss-warns-7129080/?ito=cbshare
Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroUK | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MetroUK

The push for a cashless society is all about greed

Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5045305/The-cynical-conspiracy-stop-using-cash.html#ixzz50LGqAJJD

attributes.action: Audit every MP and Lord to check on the Cyber Security of their office
attributes.background: In the light of claims made by some MPs on twitter that they have shared their computer password with their office team we believe there is a major cyber security risk throughout the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.additional_details: We understand that the rules set out for employees in Westminster make it clear that passwords should not be disclosed to other people. However the tweets referred to above indicate that at least 2 MPs have failed to follow these rules.

attributes.action: Science is compulsory at GCSE. Make it an option.
attributes.background: Help young secondary students realise their potential and stop the stigma around academic subjects being "more necessary. "
attributes.additional_details: As a society we have advanced enough for there to be jobs in a variety of different industries. There are opportunities to go down career paths besides a scientific one. Creativity and individuality should be something we teach the youth of today, it's dissapointing that the education system has rules set in place that make students feel they aren't clever enough just because they are not as academically gifted as others. Science is compulsory, but wouldn't it seem wrong if Drama or Art was made compulsory at GCSE? Students are not shunned for "lack of creativity" so why should it be the other way around? Please sign this petition so the government may consider debating this.

attributes.action: Make a Mother Earth Rights Act
attributes.background: Follow the example of Bolivia and Ecuador, make a law which gives Mother Earth, trees and creatures legal personage. This would help lawyers to better advocate on behalf of nature- this would have been particularly useful in the case of Sheffields street trees and against fracking in beauty spots.
attributes.additional_details: Review the Universal declaration of the rights of mother earth (Cochabamba, Bolivia, 22 April) and impliment some of the legal protections into UK law. To give stronger protection to the environment and to forfil UK obligations to the Convention of Biological Diversity.

attributes.action: Community Alarm Services should be permitted to use bus lanes without penalty.
attributes.background: We are firmly of the belief that Community Alarm Services are a vital emergency service in the community for vulnerable people. The service providers should be able to use bus lanes to speed up their travel time to their service users to reduce or prevent further injury and distress.

attributes.action: Make the questions on PIP forms more suitable for mental health sufferers.
attributes.background:
Recently many people have had their Personal independence payment stopped and are no longer meeting the criteria. 
 From experience i think the questions are more aimed at people with physical disabilities and mental retardations rather than mental health issues.
attributes.additional_details:
Questions such as how far can you walk?
Can you prepare food?
Can you wash yourself?
To make the forms more suitable for people suffering with severe mental health issues they need to be asking questions such as...
1. How is your sleep effected?
2. How do you feel when you go outside?
3. Do you have times when you neglect your hygiene?
4. Have you ever had addiction problems?
5. How are you at handling your finances?
6. How is your memory?
7. How often do you experience a symptom? Ect ect...

attributes.action: More funding towards cure research for Type 1 Diabetes
attributes.background: In June 2017 at the age of 18, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. Beforehand I was perfectly healthy. I did nothing to cause this to come on, nor does anyone else suffering from this unfair disease.
attributes.additional_details: I'm requesting far more funding to go towards finding a cure for Type 1 Diabetes so that people who suffer from this unfair disease can have some hope.

attributes.action: All children should be tested for Autism before they are five years old
attributes.background: All children should be tested for Autism before they are five years old, following the Norway model, to ensure early diagnosis of autism and resultant improved life chances and educational outcomes

attributes.action: Guarantee divorced/separated parents a minimum level of access to their children
attributes.background: Without a court order a divorced/ seperated parent has no automatic right to see their children. I’d like there to be a set minimum level of access granted to parents without the need for court orders that may take a long time to approve and are very costly to obtain.

attributes.action: Drop 4 of the 5 law changes that will affect UK motorists due later in 2018
attributes.background:
There are 5 motoring law changes that will affect the motorists of UK due to come into effect later in the year of 2018.

The new laws that this petition is against cover:
1. New driver restrictions, 2. Changes to VED for diesel cars, 3. MOT changes, 4. Leaner Drivers on motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see this article by DriveTribe for further information as linked below.

https://drivetribe.com/p/five-law-changes-that-will-affect-Utdk30x1QSOK_59b7U6Wfw?iid=Ifgt4G3vSGC2VK9QA6F34A&utm_campaign=idiotukdrivers&utm_medium=fb&utm_source=network

attributes.action: Grant diplomatic status to Julian Assange so that he can leave the UK
attributes.background: Julian Assange of Wikileaks cannot leave the Ecuadorian Embassy in London because he fears arrest & extradition to the USA. Swedish prosecutors have dropped a rape investigation. The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention has found that he is subject to arbitrary detention.
attributes.additional_details: There is still a UK arrest warrant for Julian Assange for a breach of bail conditions related to the now dropped rape investigation. The issue is that the UK Government will not guarantee his safe passage.

attributes.action: Give employment rights to contracted employees with less than 2 years service.
attributes.background:
If unfairly dismissed from a position when you have been with a company for less than 2 years, presently you can do nothing about it. 
If you have worked for 2 years or more, you can file for unfair dismissal.
attributes.additional_details:
Example: Jenifer was promoted after 12 months working, but after 4 months in the new position, Jenifer was dismissed. The reason given was that she was not picking the new job up as quickly as the employer thought she should be. 
No further training was offered, or the option to go back to her previous role. This was unfair dismissal, however she had only worked for the company for 18 months. ACAS are not able to assist in this case, which the company knew when dismissing her. Action is needed!

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Nurseries to charge on Bank Holidays or when closed.
attributes.background: I am a full time working parent, I have been since my daughter was 9 months old. I have paid in the region of £1300-950 a month for my child to attend full time nursery. Nurseries still have the right to charge full fees when closed or Bank holidays. Which means double fees or unpaid/annual leave.
attributes.additional_details: I understand it is so difficult for mums to take that leap back to work when childcare costs so much money!!! Unless you're unemployed or less hours you don't seem to be entitled to anything. Nurseries then have the right to charge for days the nursery is closed. Including Bank Holidays, training days & other. Some of us working parents that don't have family then have to pay out double fees or have to take annual or unpaid leave for this facility. It's another penalty that should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Lower the abortion time frame from 24 weeks to 23 weeks.
attributes.background: The 23-week survival rate in England and Wales was 23 per cent in 2010, and in 2014, the latest year for which data is available, 33 per cent of babies born at 23 weeks reached their first birthday. The figure is continuously rising due to medical advances.

attributes.action: Make it ILLEGAL to sell chemical hair straighteners for young children.
attributes.background: Retailers know of the damage they’re causing to young mostly black impressionable girls. Scalp irritation, hair damage, breakage and loss.CHEMICAL BURNS on young skin for an unattainable beauty standard.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-breastcancer-hair-dyes/dark-hair-dye-and-chemical-relaxers-linked-to-breast-cancer-idUSKBN19X229

http://www.haroldsplace.com/say-no-to-relaxers-on-children-

http://www.curlynikki.com/2011/04/should-relaxers-be-used-on-children.html

attributes.action: Increase financial support for students
attributes.background: Data shows student rents can swallow up to 95% of the current monthly instalment, resulting in negative effects on students' mental health and academic attainment. This also disproportionately impacts students from lower income backgrounds and is a limit on their ability to access higher education.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.savethestudent.org/accommodation/national-student-accommodation-survey-2018.html

attributes.action: Make the Home Secretary explain to Parliament the lack of FGM prosecutions.
attributes.background: FGM has been illigal since the passing of the Prohibition of Female Circumcision Act 1985 yet there hasn't been a single conviction despite the estimated 103 thousand girls living with the consequences of FGM the UK. Such investigations are a police matter and they answer to the Home Secretary.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/female-genital-mutilation-fgm-case-per-hour-uk-nhs-circumcision-a7564571.html

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/jul/05/nhs-attended-to-9000-fgm-cases-in-england-last-year-report-reveals

http://www.bbc.com/news/health-40491311

attributes.action: To make the new British passports post Brexit Rainbow colour
attributes.background: One of the major issues for Brexiters is the blue passport of a bygone age. It does not represent the modern multicultural Britain of today. It further fuels the divide. Those supporting the inclusive, vibrant nation that we are today should support a rainbow coloured passport that reflects this.

attributes.action: Review eligibility date for Officers to get Long Service & Good Conduct medal.
attributes.background: I have recently discovered that Army Officer serving since 2014 will be issued with a Long Service and Good Conduct medal. I view this is a slap in the face for former Officers, such as my father, who served prior to the 2014 deadline, who is still alive, and spent 35 years in the British Army.
attributes.additional_details: I am aware of many former Officers who served full careers with the British Army and left without receiving a medal of any sort.  It would be a great honour for them to receive such an award after 15+ years of unblemished military service.  I would therefore wish for the eligibility date to be extended to those Officers who have served 15+ years since 1900, with the ability for their offspring to apply for the award.

attributes.action: Abolish 3 points for vehicles with defective tyres CU30, change to a fine only!
attributes.background: Drivers get 3 points for defective tyres as it stands, I find this far too severe a punishment when combined with a fine as it leads to insurance being dearer. A fine is ample enough.
attributes.additional_details: Dvla offence code CU30

attributes.action: Offer tests for women on the NHS after ONE miscarriage
attributes.background: I have suffered 5 miscarriages in total, one being this year in 2017. I knew after the first two that something wasn’t right and pushed and pushed for testing. Unfortunately the NHS guidelines currently say that women need to have had 3 consecutive miscarriages before being offered tests.
attributes.additional_details: Now after 5 miscarriages I have been tested and found to have (aps) often known as sticky blood which means I would need a blood thinning injection daily if I was to become pregnant again. This could have saved my 5 babies’ lives but because of this guidance, that unfortunately wasn’t the case. I am hoping to get this changed so other women like myself can get the answers and save the heartbreak please help.

attributes.action: Make the rate of the living wage as recommended by the living wage foundation
attributes.background: The Tory government brought in the living wage to help eradicate poverty. I am calling for the living wage set by the government to be the rate set by the Living Wage Foundation, currently set at £8.45 per hour, and not the one set way below it.

attributes.action: QTS for Indian teachers.
attributes.background: Bachelor of Education degree (B.Ed.) must be recognised as QTS ( Qualified teacher status) in UK. In the same way as teaching degrees from EEA, US, Australia & New Zealand are recognised.
attributes.additional_details: The Indian education system has produced doctors, engineers and qualified professionals, working around the world. Ironic, that our teachers cannot work with their degree in UK, but can vote here!

attributes.action: Introduce an Act making it mandatory to manufacture British passports in the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom should, like many other countries, restrict where it's passports are made and  insist that it's passports are manufactured, by law,  in the United Kingdom by a United Kingdom registered company.

attributes.action: Please give every child in England the opportunity to study Classics.
attributes.background: Threatened by govt funding cuts and a reputation of elitism & irrelevance, the study of Classics in state schools is in peril.Yet, it continues to be taught in most private schools-for good reason. Classics explores what is eternal about humanity. It teaches us to think & debate. Skills we all need.
attributes.additional_details: Classical ideals of wisdom & virtue formed the foundations of our education system. Increasingly however, we have adopted a more utilitarian approach to the education of the majority: where the focus is the creation of individuals whose labours can best serve the economy.The type of education system we create, determines the type of society we create. A stressful, competitive system that focuses on preparing students to be valuable to an economy, does not nurture the healthiest individuals - nor the healthiest societies.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for workers under 18 years old.
attributes.background: The minimum wage for all will rise in April of 2018, but that of under 18s by a lesser amount. Young people between the ages of 16 and 18 may sustain themselves for a variety of reasons, and it is limiting, unnecessary and frankly insulting to be legally paid almost half the wage of our colleagues.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website on the National Minimum Wage states that 'Typical hourly earnings for 16-17 year olds were £5.15 in 2014 and £6.53 for 18-20 year olds (both excluding apprentices). This compares to £11.74 for workers aged 21 and over.'

www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/property/first-time-buyer-age-increase-1960s-housing-market-cost-property-ladder-a8244501.html%3famp

www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2014/jan/21/record-levels-young-adults-living-home-ons

attributes.action: the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards" to British citizens
attributes.background: Many British citizens, while staying in other European countries, risk being fined for failing to carry a national identity card or passport, because the British passport is insufficiently small or durable to carry at all times. Therefore the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards".

attributes.action: Add the discrimination against people with tattoos to The Equality Act
attributes.background: Currently the discrimination against people with tattoos in and out the work place is evident within the UK, we need to ensure people with tattoos are safe guarded against discrimination

attributes.action: A total ban on hunting for sport including the digging out of foxes and badgers!
attributes.background: Hunting for sport in the 21st century is both barbaric and cruel. Just because it's tradition doesn't make it right! It's not just the wildlife that suffers, dogs and horses suffer as well!

attributes.action: Ban plastic drinking straws in pubs, cafes, cinemas and restaurants.
attributes.background: The use of plastic drinking straws in establishments that sell liquid refreshment, either alcoholic or non alcoholic should be banned. They are unnecessary, a waste of plastic as they are for single use only, harmful to the environment, land and sea creatures.

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the usa
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I myself am 27 and have never known my biological father and I am at an age where I would like my step father to be allowed to do so if he wishes.

attributes.action:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease
attributes.background:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
Smoking Shisha can be 100 times more harmful than smoking cigarettes. It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease and respiratory disease.
attributes.additional_details: A World Health Organization study has suggested that during one session on a hookah (around 20 to 80 minutes) a person can inhale the same amount of smoke as a cigarette smoker consuming 100 or more cigarettes. Hookah smoke also contains nicotine, cancer-causing chemicals and toxic gases such as carbon monoxide.Despite the wholesome-sounding flavours, shisha tobacco is just as dangerous and is linked to the same life-threatening diseases, such as heart disease and cancer.

attributes.action: charge people who need an ambulance or hospital care due to excessive drinking.
attributes.background:
Hospital admissions – narrow measure
There were 339 thousand estimated admissions related to alcohol consumption in 2015/16. This is 3% higher than 2014/15 and 22% higher than 2005/06.
This represents 2.1% of all hospital admissions which has changed little in the last 10 years.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS resorses would be better spent on people who really need it rather than self inflicted drunkenness. How may people have died as a result of an ambulance or hospital bed not being available because of irresponsible people excessively drinking.
If people can afford to get drunk they can afford the cost of recovering from it.

attributes.action: Make it legal for motorcyclists to ride without a helmet on
attributes.background: In the UK it has been illegal for most to ride with a helmet on. This does not apply to certain religious groups. I think that bikers from all walks of life should get the choice if they use a helmet or not.
attributes.additional_details: When Motor Cycles (Wearing of Helmets) Regulations 1973 (S.I., 1973, No. 180) was passed, it became illegal in the UK for anyone to ride without a helmet on. This was amended by the Crash-Helmets (Religious Exemption) Act, 1976, to give some groups the ability to opt out of using them. I don't debate that they have saved lives, but a study done in the US stated that it was only a 37% decrease. Furthermore it is primarily the biker that will face the consequences, so why force them into using one.

attributes.action: To arm all police officers with handguns
attributes.background: I believe all police officers should be armed with handguns for officers protection. Over the last 2 years terror attacks have become increasingly regular and some could have been stopped with a simple shot from an officer. It will add security to the job of law enforcement and act as a deterrent
attributes.additional_details: In America it has been seen that police can be attacked and that a handgun can prevent that. It can also bring an end to criminal situations much faster.

attributes.action: Garages must provide free air & water in working order for drivers at all times.
attributes.background: Road safety requires that drivers maintain vehicles by law, yet garages charge for & / or fail to provide working air and water at petrol stations. This petition seeks a legal requirement, that all petrol stations must provide free air & water services at all times as a condition of trading.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 8459 petrol stations in the UK in 2016 (Source: Statista) The experience of many drivers nationally is that air & water services are often lacking, of poor quality, not working & / or expensive. 
Oil companies & government make profit & tax revenue from motorists. This petition seeks to ensure that drivers may be assured of the free provision of air & water services, maintained in good working order at all times, this being a condition of trading for all garages throughout the UK.

attributes.action: Only allow students to register to vote in one constituency
attributes.background: In the 2017 general election students registered to vote in their town and university town. I would like them to only be able to register to vote in one constituency in general elections.

attributes.action: Stop funding the BBC with taxpayer money
attributes.background: The BBC does not represent the public fairly anymore, it is a biased Corporation that is over funded with taxpayer money.

attributes.action: Change the official name & branding of the House of Lords to the House of Peers
attributes.background:
While over 25% of the members of the House of Lords are women, the name erases their existence, ignores their achievements and puts a gendered restriction in the heart of our nation's Parliament.

By changing the official name to the House of Peers, along with all branding, we can fix this mistake
attributes.additional_details: Today is International Women's Day 2018, sixty years since women were first allowed to sit as peers. If we could change our Parliament's name by IWD 2019 to include the 209 female peers who help make our country's laws, that would be a wonderful celebration of 60 years of women in British democracy.

attributes.action: Make Debeaking Illegal in the egg and meat industry
attributes.background:
Debeaking is the partial removal of a chicken's beak, commonly used in the egg industry.

It has been proven that a chickens beak is highly sensitive as it is highly nervated (Davis,2004) it has also been proven chickens then have trouble eating as a result of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Debeaking is banned in Sweden, Finland, Norway (Picket H, 2008) Austria (The Ranger, 2014) and Denmark (Farming UK, 2015a). A ban was due to come in force in 2011 but it was postponed until 2016 and is still legal today.

Let's help these poor chickens!

attributes.action: Stop non-UK residents donating money to UK political lobby groups.
attributes.background: Soros and others have their own agenda. People who don’t live in the UK should not be allowed to influence British politics by donating funds to lobby groups.

attributes.action: A petition to action Government to posthumously pardon all Suffragettes
attributes.background: From 1900 to the beginning of WW1 approximately 1,000 women were imprisoned in the British campaign to gain the votes for women.These women suffered and sacrificed a lifetime for generations today to live an equal life.These women should be posthumously pardoned and celebrated for their bravery.
attributes.additional_details: As a relative of Emmeline Pankhurst there has never been a more appropriate time to pursue the notion of having suffragettes that were imprisoned during the Votes for Women campaign posthumously pardoned and their efforts celebrated. Despite the peaceful efforts of Millicent Fawcett, Emmeline and her daughters at the start of the campaign, progress was slow and their voices dampened. Many courageous women pushed the campaign forward in a way that ensured their voices were heard 'Votes for Women'

attributes.action: Establish a support body to advise and protect Beneficiaries of Wills and Trusts
attributes.background: Support body to provide free help and advice to beneficiaries:  To ensure proper estate administration.  Advising on; confusing Will language, dwindling estate concerns, uncertainty of legal rights, high executor fee charges, lack of transparency or information, unresponsive administrators etc.
attributes.additional_details:
This support body (funded by increase in Probate tax) to:-

•Provide legal advice to beneficiaries in clear and simple terms   
•Ensure executor accountability 
•Have powers to take action against executors to protect beneficiaries where there are failings in responsibilities and duty of care.

We ask for Parliament to change the law, ensuring that executors are legally bound to clearly inform beneficiaries of the existence of this body and provide its contact details with Will delivery.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of dogs in pet shops and introduce stricter licensing requirements.
attributes.background: Puppy farms breed masses of dogs for profit with little regard for their welfare. Many dogs in pet shops come from these puppy farms, so by banning their sale it will help drive them out of business.
attributes.additional_details: The legal limit of litters per bitch should also be lowered from six to four, to protect the health of the mother. It should be mandatory for the buyer of a puppy to first see the dog at home with its mother. This should crack down on the reselling of dogs through a third party.

attributes.action: Stop hospitals from charging blue badge holders parking in hospitals
attributes.background: As if people with disabilities don't have enough to worry about without some hospitals now charging them to park. People on disability are an easy target and often have to visit hospitals frequently through no fault of their own and to start charging them to park is a disgrace.
attributes.additional_details: We need to put an end to this and support the disabled not punish them for their disability. This can only be seen as greed and it needs to be sorted out now.

attributes.action: Get the UK to ban all single use plastic items by 2030.
attributes.background:
Around 8 million tons of plastic enter the oceans each year, which is like emptying a garbage truck of plastic into an ocean every minute.

Governments MUST realize that the convenience of plastic is not worth the harm it causes

attributes.action: Make typing and full keyboard skills a compulsory part of secondary education.
attributes.background:
Children today are having to do much of their education online and on computers.  Yet they are not taught to type properly.  This leads to slow work and frustration.  
We do not give a child a pencil and expect them to learn to write. Yet we give them a keyboard and expect them to learn to type.
